proofOfConcept.body: This is a self-initiated professional Data Science project built using real-world public data to demonstrate end-to-end forecasting, deep learning modeling, and business-oriented decision support for national energy systems.

sections.overview: To support national grid stability and cost-efficient energy dispatch, I developed a deep learning model using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural networks for hourly electricity demand forecasting. Using public data representative of Bangladesh's power grid (PGCB), the model processes 168-hour sequences to predict consumption patterns with high accuracy (3.95% MAPE), enabling proactive capacity planning and optimized resource allocation for a system managing ~25,700 MW.
businessValue: Grid Stability: Prevents blackouts and overload conditions through accurate demand foresight
Resource Allocation: Optimizes generation across coal, gas, hydro, and renewable sources
Cost Optimization: Matches supply with demand to minimize wasteful generation and fuel waste
Data-Driven Planning: Replaces rule-based scheduling with predictive intelligence
keyResults: Achieved **3.95% MAPE** and **320.21 MW MAE** in hourly demand forecasting
Successfully captured diurnal and weekly cycles using **Long Short-Term Memory** networks
Developed a production-ready model with over **129,000 optimized parameters**
benefits: Proactive deployment of generation capacity before demand peaks
Early warning system for potential supply-demand imbalances
Scalable architecture for regional or national grid forecasting
Exportable model architecture ready for enterprise production deployment
